article.headline: Santa Clara 63, UC Riverside 61
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) -- Travis Niesen had 23 points and 14 rebounds to lead Santa Clara to a 63-61 victory over UC Riverside in the first round of the Cable Car Classic on Wednesday night. John Bryant scored 14 of his 16 points in the first half and added 17 rebounds for the Broncos (6-4), who improved to 4-1 at home. Mitch Henke added 10 points. Rickey Porter scored 22 points to lead UC Riverside (0-9), which dropped its 13th straight dating to last season. The Highlanders are off to their worst start since their first season in 1954-55. The Highlanders lost their previous eight games by an average of 19.5 points. Santa Clara will play Bucknell, a 63-57 winner over Boston University, in Thursday's championship game. BU plays UC Riverside in the third-place contest. Niesen converted a three-point play with 5 1/2 minutes left to play to give Santa Clara a 60-48 edge and complete a 24-10 run over a 10-minute span. The Broncos held off a late charge from UC Riverside, which scored 15 of the final 18 points to draw within the final margin heading into the final minute. Porter had a final shot for the Highlanders but missed a 3-point attempt with time running out. The Highlanders led 23-16 late in the first half, their largest lead of the season against a Division I opponent. UC Riverside held a 13-point halftime edge against Division III Puget Sound last week. UC Riverside led 31-30 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
